授業目的:
This course is designed for students who need an introductory historical background of modern Korean society. Rather than tracing its history chronologically, we will examine the volatile geopolitical situation of contemporary Korean society and look back at the events that led to
the current situation. We will also examine the legacy of Japan’s colonial rule, the historical influence of the United States, and contemporary issues such as militarism, gender, social movements and education.
到達目標: Through this course students will be able to learn a part of modern Korean history and society
授業方法: This course will be conducted by face-to-face with lecture, documentary films and discussion

第1回: Week 1 Introduction of course goals and issues.
第2回: Week 2　Pre modern short history and characteristics of Korean culture.
第3回: Week 3　Over view of Japan’s colonial policies
第4回: Week 4　Legacy of colonialism and post-war unsolved issues
第5回: Week 5　Formation of Two nations and Korea war
第7回: Week 7　Learning the society North Korea
第8回: Week 8　A documentary film “Beyond the DMZ”.
第9回: Week 9 　Learning the politics and society of South Korea
第10回: Week 10　A documentary film of democratization movement
第11回: Week 11　Field trip to Korean town in Osaka
第14回: Week 14 Over all refelction on the course
トピック.授業外学習2: Reading some articles related to Korea
